NMF Standalone

  • View page source

Utilities Package

This package contains utility functions for visualization, export, and analysis support.

Visualization Utilities

utils.gen_cloud.generate_wordclouds(topics_data, output_dir, table_name)[source]

Generate and save word cloud images for each topic.

Parameters:

  • topics_data (dict) – Dictionary mapping topic names to lists of words with scores

  • output_dir (str) – Base output directory path

  • table_name (str) – Analysis identifier for subdirectory naming

Returns:

Saves word cloud images to disk

Return type:

None

utils.topic_dist.gen_topic_dist(W, output_dir, table_name)[source]

Generate and save a bar plot showing document distribution across topics.

Parameters:

  • W (numpy.ndarray) – Document-topic matrix from NMF decomposition

  • output_dir (str) – Base output directory path

  • table_name (str) – Analysis identifier for file naming

Returns:

Saves distribution plot to disk

Return type:

None

Export Utilities

utils.export_excel.export_topics_to_excel(topics_data, output_dir, table_name)[source]

Export topics data to Excel with words sorted by topics: - First column contains words ordered by their topic appearance - Each topic has its own column - Cells contain scores only if the word appears in that topic

utils.save_doc_score_pair.save_doc_score_pair(base_dir, output_dir, table_name, topics_data, result)[source]

Processes topic word scores and saves them as a JSON file in a structured directory format.

This function takes topic data containing word-score pairs in string format, parses them into a structured dictionary, and saves the result to a JSON file. The output is organized in a directory structure under the specified base directory.

Parameters:

  • base_dir (str) – The base directory path where the output folder will be created.

  • output_dir (str) – Output directory parameter (currently unused in implementation).

  • table_name (str) – Name of the table/dataset, used for creating subdirectories and naming the output file.

  • topics_data (dict) – Dictionary where keys are topic names and values are lists of word-score strings in format “word:score” or “multi word:score”.

  • result – Additional result parameter (currently unused in implementation).

Returns:

A dictionary where keys are topic names and values are dictionaries mapping

words to their corresponding float scores.

Return type:

dict

Side Effects:

  • Creates directory structure: {base_dir}/Output/{table_name}/

  • Saves JSON file: {table_name}_wordcloud_scores.json in the created directory

  • Prints status messages for successful saves or errors

Example

topics_data = {

“topic1”: [“machine learning:0.85”, “data science:0.75”], “topic2”: [“neural network:0.90”, “deep learning:0.88”]

}

result = save_doc_score_pair(“/path/to/base”, “”, “my_table”, topics_data, None) # Creates: /path/to/base/Output/my_table/my_table_wordcloud_scores.json # Returns: {“topic1”: {“machine learning”: 0.85, “data science”: 0.75}, …}

Note

  • Words containing colons will be handled correctly by joining all parts except the last

  • Invalid word-score entries are skipped with error messages printed to console

  • The function ensures ASCII compatibility is maintained in JSON output

utils.save_topics_db.save_topics_to_db(topics_data, data_frame_name, topics_db_eng)[source]

Helper function to save topics directly to database using SQLAlchemy

Analysis Utilities

utils.coherence_score.p_word_pair(word1, word2, documents)[source]

Calculates the probability of a word pair in a document P(w1,w2) = D(w1,w2) / N D(w1,w2) = number of documents containing both word1 and word2

utils.coherence_score.p_word(word, documents)[source]

Calculates the probability of a word in a document P(w) = D(w) / N D(w) = number of documents containing word w N = total number of documents

utils.coherence_score.pmi(word1, word2, documents, epsilon=1e-09)[source]

Calculates the probability of a word pair in a document P(w1,w2) = D(w1,w2) / N D(w1,w2) = number of documents containing both word1 and word2 PMI(w1,w2) = log(P(w1,w2) / (P(w1) * P(w2)))

utils.coherence_score.get_documents_from_db(table_name, column_name)[source]

Get documents from SQLite database.

Parameters:

  • table_name (str) – Name of the table containing the documents

  • column_name (str) – Name of the column containing the text

Returns:

List of document texts

Return type:

list

utils.coherence_score.c_uci(topics_json, table_name=None, column_name=None, documents=None, epsilon=1e-09)[source]

Calculates the UCI coherence score for topics UCI(w1,w2) = 2 / (N * (N-1)) * sum_i sum_j PMI(w_i,w_j)

Parameters:

  • topics_json (dict) – Dictionary containing topics and their word scores

  • table_name (str, optional) – Name of the table containing the documents

  • column_name (str, optional) – Name of the column containing the text

  • documents (list, optional) – List of documents for co-occurrence calculation. If None and table_name is provided, will fetch from database. If both None, will use topics themselves as documents.

  • epsilon (float) – Small value to prevent log(0)

Returns:

Dictionary containing topic coherences and average coherence

Return type:

dict

utils.coherence_score.doc_cooccurrence(word1, word2, documents)[source]

Counts number of documents where word1 and word2 co-occur

utils.coherence_score.word_doc_count(word, documents)[source]

Counts number of documents containing the word

utils.coherence_score.u_mass(topics_json, table_name=None, column_name=None, documents=None, epsilon=1e-09)[source]

Calculates the U-Mass coherence score for topics U-Mass uses log conditional probability: log(P(w2|w1)) = log(P(w1,w2)/P(w1))

Parameters:

  • topics_json (dict) – Dictionary containing topics and their word scores

  • table_name (str, optional) – Name of the table containing the documents

  • column_name (str, optional) – Name of the column containing the text

  • documents (list, optional) – List of documents for co-occurrence calculation. If None and table_name is provided, will fetch from database. If both None, will use topics themselves as documents.

  • epsilon (float) – Small value to prevent log(0)

Returns:

Dictionary containing topic coherences and average coherence

Return type:

dict

utils.coherence_score.calculate_coherence_scores(topic_word_scores, output_dir=None, table_name=None, column_name=None)[source]

Calculate coherence scores (U-Mass) and optionally save them.

Parameters:

  • topic_word_scores (dict) – Dictionary of topics and their word scores

  • output_dir (str, optional) – Directory to save the scores. If None, scores won’t be saved

  • table_name (str, optional) – Name of the table/analysis for file naming and database access

  • column_name (str, optional) – Name of the column containing the document text

Returns:

Dictionary containing coherence scores

Return type:

dict

utils.word_cooccurrence.calc_word_cooccurrence(H, sozluk, base_dir, table_name, top_n=100, min_score=1, language='EN', tokenizer=None)[source]

Calculates word co-occurrence matrix from NMF H matrix and saves results to a JSON file.

This function computes how often words appear together in the same document based on the NMF topic-word matrix (H). It identifies the most frequent word pairs, returns them as a DataFrame, and saves them to a JSON file in the specified output directory.

Parameters:

  • H (numpy.ndarray) – Topic-word matrix from NMF decomposition.

  • sozluk (list) – Vocabulary list where indices correspond to word IDs.

  • base_dir (str) – Base directory path for saving output.

  • table_name (str) – Name of the table/dataset for file naming.

  • top_n (int, optional) – Number of top pairs to return. Default is 100.

  • min_score (float, optional) – Minimum co-occurrence score to consider. Default is 1.

  • tokenizer (tokenizers.Tokenizer)

Returns:

DataFrame with columns ‘Word 1’, ‘Word 2’, and ‘Score’,

containing the top word pairs sorted by co-occurrence score.

Return type:

pandas.DataFrame

Side Effects:

  • Creates directory structure: {base_dir}/Output/{table_name}/

  • Saves JSON file: {table_name}_cooccurrence.json in the created directory

param H:

param sozluk:

param base_dir:

param top_n:

param min_score:

Parameters:

tokenizer (Tokenizer :param tokenizer:)

utils.redis_bridge.update_progress_emit(progress, message, status, data_name, tid, task_obj=None, durum=None)[source]

Update the progress of a task and emit the status to Redis Pub/Sub. :type progress: :param progress: The progress percentage of the task. :type progress: int :type message: :param message: A message describing the current status of the task. :type message: str :type status: :param status: The current status of the task. :type status: str :type data_name: :param data_name: The name of the data being processed. :type data_name: str :type tid: :param tid: The ID of the task. :type tid: str :type task_obj: :param task_obj: The task object to check for abortion status. :type durum: :param durum: Optional parameter to check for abortion status. :type durum: str, optional

Returns:

True if the task is aborted, False otherwise.

Return type:

bool
